caption.title: Deleting the remaining p110α from fetal compartment of the conceptus results in fetal lethality in Hom-F mutants between days 11 and 12 of pregnancy.
caption.p: Frequency of viable fetuses in a litter per gestational age are displayed, with the number of litters in parentheses.

caption.title: Deleting the remaining p110α from the trophoblast in Hom-P does not affect fetal viability at day 19 of pregnancy.
caption.p: Frequency of viable fetuses in a litter are displayed, with data from n = 15 litters. Offspring genotypes were determined by conventional PCR, and in the case of Cyp19Cre mutants, additionally by qRT-PCR to identify those with a sufficient level of Pik3ca deletion (frequency is in parentheses). When the cut off for Pik3ca deletion in the placenta using qRT-PCR was applied (<65% for Het-P and <30% for Hom-P), the frequency of Cyp19Cre mutants was ~50% less.
